gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦੀਪ ਦਿਪਤ ਮਹਾਤਮੈ ਨ ਜਾਨੈ ਕੋੳੂ ਬੁਝਤ ਹੀ ਅੰਧਕਾਰ ਭਟਕਤ ਰਾਤਿ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Deep Dipat Mahaatamai N Jaanai Kooo , Bujhat Hee Andhakaar Bhatakat Raati Hai ?
translation: Just as the significance of a lit lamp is not appreciated by anyone, but when it is extinguished, one has to wander in the darkness.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਅਾਂਗਨਿ ਅਛਿਤ ਮਹਿਮਾ ਨ ਜਾਨੈ ਕਾਟਤ ਹੀ ਛਾਂਹਿ ਬੈਠਬੇ ਕੳੁ ਬਿਲਲਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Droum Aangani Achhit Mahimaa N Jaanai , Kaatat Hee Chhaanhi Baitthabay Kau Bilalaat Hai ?
translation: Just as a tree in the courtyard is not appreciated, but when felled or uprooted one longs for its shade.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਾਜਨੀਤਿ ਬਿਖੈ ਚੈਨ ਹੁੲਿ ਚਤੁਰਕੁੰਟ ਛਤ੍ਰ ਢਾਲਾ ਚਾਲ ਭੲੇ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਕੰਤ੍ਰ ਜਾਤ ਹੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Raajaneeti Bikhai Chain Hui Chaturakounta , Chhatr Ddhaalaa Chaal Bhaay Jantr Kantr Jaat Hai ?
translation: Just as enforcement of law and order of the kingdom ensures peace and prosperity everywhere, but chaos prevails when enforcement is compromised.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਮ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਜਗ ਅੰਤਰੀਛ ਭੲੇ ਪਾਛੇ ਲੋਗ ਪਛੁਤਾਤ ਹੈ ||੩੫੧||
transliteration: Taisay Gursikh Saadh Sangam Jougati Jaga , Antareechh Bhaay Paachhay Log Pachhoutaat Hai ?351?
translation: So is the unique opportunity for the Sikhs of the Guru to meet with the saintly True Guru. Once missed, everyone repents. (351)
